intro: Mesembryanthemum polyanthum, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Aizoaceae family, characterized by its succulent leaves and showy flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers, which bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red, are often clustered in dense inflorescences. It is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
